name: Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)

docs_row.name: Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)
docs_row.func_description: Retrieve reviews and tips for a specified hotel.

hotel_id.description:
hotel_id can be retrieved from api/v1/hotels/searchHotels(Search Hotels) or api/v1/hotels/searchHotelsByCoordinates(Search Hotels By Coordinates
) endpoint in Hotels collection.

sort_option_id.description: sort_option_id can be retrieved from api/v1/hotels/getHotelReviewsSortOption(Get Hotel Reviews(Tips) Sort Option) endpoint in Hotels collection.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

hotel_id.description:
hotel_id can be retrieved from api/v1/hotels/searchHotels(Search Hotels) or api/v1/hotels/searchHotelsByCoordinates(Search Hotels By Coordinates
) endpoint in Hotels collection.

sort_option_id.description: sort_option_id can be retrieved from api/v1/hotels/getHotelReviewsSortOption(Get Hotel Reviews(Tips) Sort Option) endpoint in Hotels collection.

languagecode.description:
To obtain the response data in a specific language, enter the languagecode. languagecode can be retrieved from api/v1/meta/getLanguages(Get Languages
) endpoint in Meta collection.

result.title: Pleasant
result.hotelier_response: We are glad to have provided you with a pleasant experience. It is extremely inspiring for us to get to know from guests that they had a beautiful stay. Looking forward to hosting you soon again!

result.title: Pleasant
result.hotelier_response: We are glad to have provided you with a pleasant experience. It is extremely inspiring for us to get to know from guests that they had a beautiful stay. Looking forward to hosting you soon again!

We’re glad to hear that our staff was helpful and kind, and that you appreciated the convenience of our location near the airport. However, we apologize for the unpleasant experience you had with the hallway, and we truly appreciate you bringing it to our attention. We’ll take immediate action to address the cleanliness and maintenance issues to ensure a more comfortable stay for our future guests. We hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back soon.
result.title: Pleasant
result.pros: The hotel employees were very helpful and kind. It is possible to order breakfast for certain time. Really close to the aeroport.
result.cons: To reach our room, we had to go through really long hall that was extremely dusty, smelly and it looked like a part of a chair factory.

response_summary:
The response includes reviews for a hotel, with three highlighted guest experiences. Guests can sort the reviews by "Most Relevant," "Date (Newer to Older)," or "Close to Property Score." 

The first review, from Felipe, a solo traveler from Chile, rated his stay as "Pleasant" with a score of 2.8 out of 5. He appreciated the cleanliness of the hotel and stayed in a Deluxe Room for one night in May 2025. The hotel responded warmly, expressing gratitude for his feedback and hoping to welcome him back.

Hitesh, a traveler from India visiting with friends, also rated his stay as "Pleasant" with the same score. He enjoyed the breakfast during his four-night stay in March 2025. The hotel acknowledged his positive experience and looked forward to hosting him again.

Eliška, a family traveler from the Czech Republic, gave the same rating but had mixed feedback. She praised the helpful staff and the hotel's proximity to the airport but criticized the dusty, unpleasant hallway leading to her room. The hotel apologized for the inconvenience and promised to address the issue.

In total, there are 25 reviews available for this hotel, providing a range of perspectives on the guest experience.
enhance_func_desc: This API is useful for travelers researching hotel stays and for hotel management to gather feedback. It retrieves guest reviews for a specific hotel, allowing sorting by relevance, date, or proximity score. The response includes detailed reviews with ratings, traveler types, stay details, and hotel responses, helping users assess the overall guest experience. The hotel ID must be obtained from the SearchHotels API.

enhanced_parameters.hotel_id: Unique identifier for the hotel, sourced from searchHotels or searchHotelsByCoordinates.
enhanced_parameters.sort_option_id: Sorts reviews by relevance, date, or proximity score.
enhanced_parameters.page_number: Specifies the pagination number for review results.
enhanced_parameters.languagecode: Language preference for the review response data.

sort_options.description: A list of sorting options available for the reviews.

ar_items.description: An object representing a sorting option.

sort_option_id.description: The unique identifier for the sorting option (e.g., 'sort_most_relevant').

sort_option_default.description: Indicates if this sorting option is the default (1 for yes, 0 for no).

title.description: The display name of the sorting option (e.g., 'Most relevant').

result.description: A list of reviews for the hotel.

ar_items.description: An object representing a single review.

is_moderated.description: Indicates if the review has been moderated (1 for yes, 0 for no).

hotelier_response_date.description: The timestamp of the hotel's response to the review.

languagecode.description: The language code of the review (e.g., 'en-gb').

is_incentivised.description: Indicates if the review was incentivized (1 for yes, 0 for no).

stayed_room_info.description: Details about the room the guest stayed in.

num_nights.description: The number of nights the guest stayed.

room_id.description: The unique identifier for the room.

checkout.description: The checkout date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

url_max300.description: URL for the photo with a maximum width of 300 pixels.

photo_id.description: The unique identifier for the photo.

url_original.description: URL for the original size photo.

ratio.description: The aspect ratio of the photo.

url_square60.description: URL for the square 60x60 pixels photo.

url_640x200.description: URL for the photo with dimensions 640x200 pixels.

room_name.description: The name of the room (e.g., 'Deluxe Room').

checkin.description: The check-in date in YYYY-MM-DD format.

helpful_vote_count.description: The number of helpful votes the review has received.

user_new_badges.description: A list of new badges the user has earned (empty in the examples).

title_translated.description: The translated title of the review (empty in the examples).

no_user_title.description: Indicates if the user has no title (1 for yes, 0 for no).

countrycode.description: The country code of the reviewer (e.g., 'cl').

reviewer_photos.description: A list of photos uploaded by the reviewer (empty in the examples).

review_hash.description: A unique hash identifier for the review.

tags.description: A list of tags associated with the review (empty in the examples).

pros_translated.description: The translated pros of the review (empty in the examples).

average_score.description: The average score given by the reviewer (e.g., 2.8).

reviewng.description: Indicates if the review is positive (1 for yes, 0 for no).

travel_purpose.description: The purpose of the traveler's stay (e.g., 'leisure').

hotelier_response.description: The hotel's response to the review.

pros.description: The positive aspects mentioned in the review (e.g., 'Cleanliness').

cons.description: The negative aspects mentioned in the review (empty in some examples).

review_id.description: The unique identifier for the review.

anonymous.description: Indicates if the review is anonymous (empty in the examples).

date.description: The date and time the review was posted (e.g., '2025-05-09 20:58:54').

nr_reviews.description: The number of reviews the author has written.

helpful_vote_count.description: The number of helpful votes the author has received.

countrycode.description: The country code of the author (e.g., 'cl').

user_id.description: The unique identifier for the author.

type.description: The type of traveler in code format (e.g., 'solo_traveller').

city.description: The city of the author (empty in the examples).

avatar.description: URL for the author's avatar (present in some examples).

hotel_id.description: The unique identifier for the hotel.

cons_translated.description: The translated cons of the review (empty in the examples).

count.description: The total number of reviews available for the hotel.

depends_on.reason: There is a clear business association between the 'Search_Hotels' API and the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API, as the hotel_id from the search results is a required parameter for retrieving hotel reviews. The 'hotels[].hotel_id' field from 'Search_Hotels' matches exactly with the 'hotel_id' parameter required by 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' in both data type (String vs. Number, but numbers can be easily converted to strings) and purpose. This represents a hard dependency as the search API must be called first to obtain valid hotel IDs for the reviews API.

The 'Get_Question_And_Answer' API provides a 'hotel_id' field that matches exactly with the 'hotel_id' parameter required by the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API. This represents a hard dependency as the hotel ID from the source API is a necessary prerequisite for calling the target API. The data types match (both are Strings), and the example value demonstrates the correct format for the target parameter.

The 'Get_Question_And_Answer' API provides hotel_id values in its response, which can be directly used as input for the 'hotel_id' parameter in the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API. This establishes a hard dependency as the target API explicitly requires the hotel_id parameter, and the source API provides this exact identifier. The data types match (String vs Number in example, but IDs are typically interchangeable in this context), and the source API's description confirms the hotel_id comes from the same required sources as the target API's parameter.

The 'Get_Hotel_Policies' API provides the 'hotel_id' field which is explicitly required by the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API. This represents a hard dependency as the hotel_id is a mandatory parameter for retrieving hotel reviews, and the source API's response field directly provides this identifier. The data types match (both expect a hotel identifier), and the example value from the source API matches the expected format of the target API parameter.

The 'Get_Room_List' API provides the 'hotel_id' field which is exactly what the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API requires as input. This represents a hard dependency as the hotel_id is a mandatory parameter for retrieving hotel reviews and must be obtained from a hotel search API (either directly or indirectly through room listings). The data types match (String vs Number in example, but IDs are typically interchangeable in this context), and the field serves the same business purpose of uniquely identifying a hotel.

There is a clear business association between the 'Get_Hotel_Review_Scores' API and the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API, as both require the same hotel_id parameter to retrieve information about a specific hotel. The 'hotel_id' field from 'Get_Hotel_Review_Scores' matches exactly with the 'hotel_id' parameter required by 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' in both data type (String vs Number can be easily converted) and purpose. This represents a hard dependency as the hotel_id is essential for both APIs to function.

There is a clear business association between the 'Search_Hotels_By_Coordinates' API and the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API, as the hotel_id from the former is explicitly required by the latter to fetch reviews. The response field '$.result[*].hotel_id' from 'Search_Hotels_By_Coordinates' matches the data type and purpose of the 'hotel_id' parameter in the target API. This represents a hard dependency as the hotel_id from the search API is mandatory for retrieving hotel reviews.

The 'Get_Description_And_Info' API provides the 'hotel_id' field which is explicitly required by the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API. This represents a hard dependency as the hotel ID from the source API is a mandatory parameter for the target API. The data types match (both are Strings), and the example values demonstrate compatibility. This is a clear case where the source API provides necessary input for the target API.

The 'Payment_features_of_the_Hotel' API provides the 'hotel_id' field which is exactly what the 'Get_Hotel_Reviews(Tips)' API requires as input. This represents a hard dependency because the target API explicitly states that the hotel_id must be obtained from search APIs, and the source API's response field matches both the data type (String) and the business requirement (unique hotel identifier). The example values also demonstrate direct compatibility.
